agent_utterance: Tonight's fresh micro-action: when cravings hit, do a quick three-part grounding sequence. First, name one emotion and one environmental trigger. Then log the craving level and the exact action you took. Keep a simple plan handy and aim for steady, doable steps—mindful of BED, and if the craving persists, repeat this micro-action instead of turning to food.

agent_utterance: Tonight’s small, actionable nudge: when cravings hit, run a quick 2-minute craving-check sequence to interrupt the urge and reinforce your routine. Do: 1) step away from the food area for 60 seconds, 2) drink a glass of water, 3) name one emotion and one trigger, 4) complete a 30-second box-breathing cycle (inhale 4, exhale 4). Then log the craving level and the exact action you took. Keep a simple plan handy (phone reminder or sticky note). If the craving persists, you can repeat the micro-action once more, but avoid turning to food. This keeps steps small, structured, and progressively builds toward your goal.
